body:
Sounds like a reasonable request and it is probably [supported by the SDK](https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-go)

Fancy doing a bit of research, and linking to some docs?  Or even better sending a pull request?

I'm not particularly versed enough in Go (yet) to contribute some code, but I'll pitch in with some info. For Blob Storage, there are two different kinds of SAS, one is an account level SAS which gives you access to all containers (or other storage products in this account if it's allowed, like tables or queues), the other one is a service level SAS which will give you access to a specific container (or file). 

For an account level SAS, you'll only need a different constructor - instead of https://godoc.org/github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-go/storage#NewClient you'll either need https://godoc.org/github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-go/storage#NewAccountSASClient, https://godoc.org/github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-go/storage#NewAccountSASClientFromEndpointToken or https://godoc.org/github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-go/storage#NewClientFromConnectionString, depending on which info you have. _NewClientFromConnectionString_ is probably the best one, since a connection string covers every connection method for account-level access:

* Access with an account key: 
`DefaultEndpointsProtocol=https;AccountName=<ACCOUNTNAME>;AccountKey=<ACCOUNTKEY>;BlobEndpoint=https://<ACCOUNTNAME>.blob.core.windows.net/;`
* With an SAS:
`SharedAccessSignature=sv=2017-04-17&ss=bt&srt=sco&sp=rl&st=2018-03-20T20%3A13%3A00Z&se=2018-03-21T20%3A13%3A00Z&sig=<SIGNATURE>;BlobEndpoint=https://<ACCOUNTNAME>.blob.core.windows.net/;`

IMHO it would be great to be able to either configure an Azure Blob Storage remote storage using the traditional way (account name, key, endpoint) for backwards compatibility or with a connection string, which covers everything supported by the SDK, including the former.

A service level SAS is a bit different. An SAS for a single file doesn't make much sense for rclone since it's just used to give access to a single file, but a container SAS might be useful. Using an SAS URL you can get a container instance using https://godoc.org/github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-go/storage#GetContainerReferenceFromSASURI and from there a Client instance again https://godoc.org/github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-go/storage#Container.Client

@maetthu thank you for the writeup - very helpful :-)

So it looks like adding access via `NewClientFromConnectionString` would be useful.  That looks pretty easy too.

To cover the use case of @memotype (the original poster) I'd need to add config for a SAS URL too if I'm understanding you correctly.

So the 3 config options would be
  * account/key
  * connection string
  * SAS URL (for container level access only)

This looks reasonably straight forward.  If you @maetthu and @memotype are willing to test it, I'll add the code?
@ncw of course :) If needed, I can also provide you with access to a storage account.

I've made a first attempt at this:

https://beta.rclone.org/v1.40-019-gc76f1662-azureblob-auth/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Run through `rclone config` and hopefully you'll work out what to do!

I haven't updated the docs yet.

I'd appreciate it if you could try the 3 auth methods - thanks!

Authentication from connection string works when using account/key method, although the connection string needs to have the following format (copied from Azure Portal):

`DefaultEndpointsProtocol=https;AccountName=<account-name>;AccountKey=<account-key>;EndpointSuffix=core.windows.net`

rather than the one I wrote in my earlier comment, which was copied from Azure Storage Explorer (apparently, not all connection strings are created equally :roll_eyes:)

The other two connection methods (SAS in connection string and SAS URL) unfortunately don't work, I'll check if I can dig a bit deeper into the Go SDK to find out what's wrong, it might be just an encoding thing (although I followed the example here: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/common/storage-configure-connection-string#create-a-connection-string-using-a-shared-access-signature with no luck)

* SAS in connection string reports following error:
```
2018/03/26 20:05:16 ERROR : : error reading source directory: storage: service returned error: StatusCode=400, ErrorCode=AccountRequiresHttps, ErrorMessage=The account being accessed does not support http.
RequestId:d89d2b4a-001e-0038-122c-c5161f000000
Time:2018-03-26T18:05:16.0525267Z, RequestInitiated=Mon, 26 Mar 2018 18:05:15 GMT, RequestId=d89d2b4a-001e-0038-122c-c5161f000000, API Version=, QueryParameterName=, QueryParameterValue=
2018/03/26 20:05:16 ERROR : Attempt 1/3 failed with 1 errors
2018/03/26 20:05:16 ERROR : : error reading source directory: storage: service returned error: StatusCode=400, ErrorCode=AccountRequiresHttps, ErrorMessage=The account being accessed does not support http.
RequestId:d89d2b5e-001e-0038-252c-c5161f000000
```

Although the error isn't really related to http vs https, if I enable http access to the storage account, the error changes to:
```
2018/03/26 20:24:33 ERROR : : error reading source directory: directory not found
2018/03/26 20:24:33 ERROR : Attempt 1/3 failed with 1 errors
```

* SAS url reports
```
2018/03/26 20:10:00 ERROR : : error reading source directory: Get ?comp=list&delimiter=%2F&include=metadata&maxresults=5000&restype=container: unsupported protocol scheme ""
2018/03/26 20:10:00 ERROR : Attempt 1/3 failed with 1 errors
```

Judging from this issue here https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-go/issues/464 it looks like there is  a separate go SDK for blob storage (https://github.com/Azure/azure-storage-blob-go) now apparently, where these issues might be addressed. I also found this pull request https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-go/pull/1055 which indicates that the storage part in the main go SDK will be moved away to dedicated packages, which is also noted in here: https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-go/blob/master/storage/README.md

I'm a bit confused atm what these two Go SDKs actually support or not, I'll try to find some more info about that in the next couple of days.

I appreciate the enthusiasm for this feature. @ncw Sorry I wasn't able to dig up the docs, and I'm definitely not a Go developer, just a simple sysadmin, so I won't be able to send a PR. We've currently implemented a work-around that's working for us, but using the rclone method with the SAS would definitely be preferred. Anyway, just wanted to let you know all know I wasn't just pulling a drive-by feature request. :P

@maetthu thanks for testing that :-)

> Authentication from connection string works

Hooray!

> SAS in connection string reports following error:

I note this in the docs - did you set https?

> DefaultEndpointsProtocol=[http|https];

This error

> error reading source directory: directory not found

Looks like it is almost working... 

If you wanted to do a bit more debugging with the code I posted, then I recommend using `-vv --dump bodies` which will show all the HTTP transactions - that usually helps a lot.

> SAS url reports

> error reading source directory: Get ?comp=list&delimiter=%2F&include=metadata&maxresults=5000&restype=container: unsupported protocol scheme ""

This looks like the URL is missing a protocol scheme, likely an `https:\\`  In fact it looks like it is missing the rest of the URL.  Did you put in something like "https://host.com/stuff` here?

`--dump bodies` may throw some light.

I've had interactions with the Azure Go devs and they indicated to me that the preferred package is now https://github.com/Azure/azure-storage-blob-go - however that package doesn't look particularly mature to me yet!  Also it is a lot of work swapping a backend implementation :-(

@memotype Thanks for the comment!  As far as this feature goes, happy to pull existing features out of the SDK, but I really don't have enough time to dive into the rabbit hole of the Microsoft auth system so really appreciate your help @maetthu.  Assuming we can get enough of this working to be useful, I'll ask for some help writing the docs too!

@memotype @maetthu just looking through branches I haven't merged and I found this one.

Does anyone want to help debug the bits which don't work, or shall I merge the connection string part (which does work) for v1.41?
